page.title: 19RECREATION 2
page.content: There is quite a wealth of cricket talent amongst the villagers in the area.The local branch of the N.F.U. have their own cricket section which plays mid-week friendly matches and competes in inter regional N.F.U. contests. The more serious cricket is played on Saturdays.The villages of Milton and North Wheatley each have 2 teams in the Bassetlaw League and they attract the more expert players of the area. Local rugby is catered for by the East Retford R.F.C. who turn out four teams on most Saturdays.The club has a strong fixture list in Lincolnshire, Notts, Yorkshire and Derbyshire. Their ground and clubhouse are at Ordsall. The keen anglers can find good course fishing in the River Idle,Chesterfield Canal or the still waters of the Dukeries Lakes.
